description: This recipe is by Christopher Idone and takes 50 minutes, plus freeze time. Tell us what you think of it at The New York Times - Dining - Food.
title: Orange Ice Cream
title_page: Orange Ice Cream Recipe - NYT Cooking
text: To make the orange shells, slice off the the top quarter of the orange. Carefully remove the pulp from the oranges, leaving the pith and skin intact. Drain the pulp through a sieve over a bowl and press the pulp gently to extract all the juice. Reserve one cup of the juice for the ice cream and the remainder for another use. Put the orange shells and tops in a plastic bag and freeze. When the ice cream is made, spoon it into the shells, cap and freeze until ready to serve. To make lemon ice cream, follow the above recipe, substituting a half-cup of lemon juice for the one cup of orange juice.
